intro: Ceropegia glabra, commonly known as the naked ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and small, fleshy leaves. The plant produces unique, tubular flowers that are often yellow or orange in color. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found growing on rocky surfaces or in sandy soils. Ceropegia glabra is also known for its ability to store water in its stems, making it drought-tolerant.
